results.title: Lead burning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
The flat butted seam. Preparation, shaving the surfaces, adjustment of oxyacetylene flame, spot fusing. Actual burning operation with filler strip. Similar demonstration of flat-lapped seam, lapped seam on inclined plane and upright, vertical spigot joint and burned joint between tinned brass and lead.

results.title: Le Xiveme Siecle = the Xivth Century
results.brief_description:
Year 1300 represents the apex of the cultural and economical expansion of the Midle Ages with Europe being adorned by sets of new monuments in different styles: gothic in Salisbury and Reims, oriental in Palermo and Toledo. Italy is the centre of artistic innovation and production thanks to a rich class of merchant conducting business all over Europe and the Orient. From the Cathedral, the focus shifts to the city and specially the Piazza. Major works are commissined to adorn private and civil buildings, such Simone Martini’s frescos in Sienna’s Communal House. But in 1348, the Black Plague epidemic brings the artistic expansion to a grinding halt. This marks the introduction of a macabre element in art. The serene smiles of the angel on the portal of Notre Dame is no more. At the end of the XIVth century, people have two obsessions: death of the body and the unrestrained enjoyement of the short-lived pleasures of life. This episode also profiles the works of Giotto.

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Le Voyage En Ballon = Stowaway in the Sky
results.brief_description:
A small child, fascinated by a lighter-than-air balloon, clambers aboard. The balloon takes flight, lifting the child upward to an amazing adventure.

Credits: Producer, Jean Velter ; director, Albert Lamorisse ; writer, Albert Lamorisse ; photography, Maurice Fellous ; music, Jean Podromides.
Cast: Pascal Lamorisse, Andre Gille, Maurice Baquet.

results.title: Le Village un village
results.creator_credit: Juniper Films and Tristram Wilson Productions
results.brief_description:
A study of a typical French village community, showing day-to-day activities. Includes scenes of the market place, the school, the annual fete, and a wedding. Non-narrated.
Suitable for lower secondary levels.

results.title: Le Vieux Fusil = the Old Gun
results.brief_description:
In Montauban in 1944, Julien Dandieu works as a surgeon in the local hospital. Frightened by the German army entering Montauban, he asks his friend Francois to drive his wife and daughter to a back country village where Julien owns an old castle. One week later, Julien decides to go and join his family for the week end, but the Germans are already occupying the village. On his way to the house, Julien discovers the corpses of the villagers in the church, then, further away, the charred bodies of his daughter and his wife. He vows to personally kill every one of the Germans responsible in order to assuage his grief. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1975: Best actor for Philippe Noiret ; Best film for Robert Enrico ; Best music for Francois de Roubaix.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Caro ; director, Robert Enrico ; writer, Robert Enrico, Pascal Jardin, Claude Vieillot ; photography, Etienne Becker ; music, Francois de roubaix.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Philippe Noiret, Jean Bouise, Madeleine Ozeray, Catherine Delaporte.

results.title: Le Tour 1991
results.brief_description: The Tour de France is the world’s premier cycle race. In 1991 it was held over 23 days and travelled through 3,940 kms of the most spectacular French countryside culminating in the traditional last stage ride into Paris. The two videos contain the highlights of the race, interviews with top participants, descriptions of each stage of the race, a stage by stage update on the leadership table and comments by some of the fifteen million spectators.

results.title: Le Temps des Paquebots (Ep.4)
results.brief_description:
The period in between the world ward is the golden era of the great ocean liners and transatlantic carriers, with ships sucg as the Ile-de-France, Normandy, Queen Mary vying for the supreme honour of the blue ribbon. This episode also tells the famous tale of the sinking of the Titanic and includes a lenghthy interview with one of the survivors. Other topics include: Ellis Island and migration to the USA ; the transportation of troops across the Atlantic.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Le Tango stupefiant
results.brief_description: This is an imaginary cabaret where songs from the past unexpectedly meet. It celebrates with irony, tenderness and sophistication, broken hearts and mysterious rugs. Simply staged and beautifully lit, the film brings together a range of music written between 1900 and 1940 by composers and lyricists as diverse as Satie, Schoenberg, Brecht and Weill, Benjamin and W.H. Auden.

results.title: Le Systeme du Docteur Terrier = Dr Terrier's System
results.brief_description:
The newly wed Vidocqs spend their honeymoon at Annette’s godfather’s. They receive a visit from strange characters whom Vidocq used to know when he was a convict in Toulon. They blackmail Vidocq into helping them with their forged money scheme.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Henri Cremieux, Jacques Dhery, Gilberte Geniat, Marion Loran, Harry Max, Jacques Seiler.
